snippet: Paying the first month’s premium is the final step in completing an enrollment, and those who did not pay did not receive coverage in January.
abstract: Insurance companies and industry experts say one in five people who signed up for health insurance under health care law failed to pay their premiums on time and therefore did not receive coverage in January 2014.
lead_paragraph: Paying the first month’s premium is the final step in completing an enrollment, and those who did not pay did not receive coverage in January.

headline.main: One-Fifth of New Enrollees Under Health Care Law Fail to Pay First Premium
headline.print_headline: Some Fail to Pay Premium After Signing Up

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: Blue Cross and Blue Shield Assn
keywords.name: organizations
